Title: A bottom-up approach to map land covers as potential green infrastructure hubs for human well-being in rural settings: A case study from Sweden
GenInfo: Interviewed residents along urban/rural gradient for their value of ecosystem services from different landscapes, then mapped those land cover types.

Title: A framework to quantify the strength of ecological links between an environmental stressor and final ecosystem services
MethodsNotes: created a framework to analyze data from a national database

Title: Abundance of urban male mosquitoes by green infrastructure types: implications for landscape design and vector management
GenInfo: With an aim to examine urban adult vector mosquitoes and green roofs, the study design incorporates three distinctively different types of urban environments as treatment and control sites—green roofs (GR), bare roofs as negative control sites (NC), and low-elevation green space as positive control (PC)

Title: Accounting for residential propagule pressure improves prediction of urban plant invasion
GenInfo: county-wide parcel data used to determine housing density. observed p/a of Chinese pivet (invasive) at each location. the rest was calculation and mapping

Title: An agent-based approach to modeling impacts of agricultural policy on land use, biodiversity and ecosystem services
GenInfo: Agent-based model calibrated by observed data

Title: An analysis of trade-offs between multiple ecosystem services and stakeholders linked to land use and water quality management in the Great Barrier Reef, Australia
GenInfo: Australia. Terrestrial catchment land use and effect on Great Barrier Reef. Produced hypothetical land use scenarios and looked at outcomes/tradeoffs for services.

Title: Analysing scale, quality and diversity of green infrastructure and the provision of Urban Ecosystem Services: A case from Mexico City
GenInfo: As far as I can tell, this appears to be a paper focused largely on valuation of ES's in Mexico city... little ecology except for incorporating the idea of scale

Title: Applying network theory to prioritize multispecies habitat networks that are robust to climate and land-use change
GenInfo: climate projections for 2025 and 2050. In the question about how many years of data they use, I'm referring to the data they used to calibrate their model.

Title: Applying network theory to prioritize multispecies habitat networks that are robust to climate and land-use change
GenInfo: Distribution data from 1971-2000, simulated projections to 2025 and 2050

Title: Arable weeds as indicators of agricultural intensity - A case study from Finland
GenInfo: used trophic interactions to define relative importance of weed species for animal groups

Title: Assessing and mapping of multiple ecosystem services in Guizhou Province, China
GenInfo: InVEST model of services with remotely sensed data combined with model parameter values from the literature

Title: Assessing and predicting the relative ecological impacts of disturbance on habitats with different sensitivities
GenInfo: Study done in the North Sea (chose Atlantic); trawling frequency data came from European Community Satellite Vessel Monitoring System (counted that as observational), otherwise modeled productivity and biomass of seabeds based on a published model. Model output validated with observational data from 33 stations subject to range of trawling in North Sea.

Title: Assessing bundles of ecosystem services from regional to landscape scale: insights from the French Alps
MethodsNotes: used open data from published sources

Title: BIMBY's first steps: a pilot study on the contribution of residential front-yards in Phoenix and Maastricht to biodiversity, ecosystem services and urban sustainability
GenInfo: Observational data collected through field notes and taking photos in front-yard visits

Title: Biodiversity and ecological long-term plots in Southern Patagonia to support sustainable land management: The case of PEBANPA network
GenInfo: In 2002, the PEBANPA (Parcelas de Ecología y Biodiversidad de Ambientes Naturales en Patagonia Austral) Network was estab- lished to monitor these ecosystems and to produce scientific research focused on ecosystem function and ES (e.g. soil carbon stocks, nutrients, forestry), as well as on trends in biodiversity and the interactions between natural environments and land-use activities throughout southern Patagonia, Argentina. Long-term monitoring assesses bio-indicators, which therefore reveal the cur- rent state of the environment, particular stresses in ecosystems and early warnings of environmental changes ahead.

Title: Biodiversity-multifunctionality relationships depend on identity and number of measured functions
GenInfo: 81 plots of different combinations of plants. measured EF variables

Title: Biofuels on the landscape: Is "land sharing" preferable to "land sparing"?
GenInfo: Modeling paper that uses a 30yr or 100yr timeframe for estimating greenhouse gas emissions, but this is different from a specific look at changes in an ES over time

Title: Challenging the land degradation in China's Loess Plateau: Benefits, limitations, sustainability, and adaptive strategies of soil and water conservation
GenInfo: Compiled data from published datasets (e.g. soil maps from other studies, derived from Landsat), weather stations, MODIS (used for NDVI), Gravity Recovery and Climate Experiment (GRACE) to aproximate groundwater levels, and used an empirical model (Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation) to model soil erosion over space. Validated model output with comparative values from related literature.

Title: China's progress towards sustainable land degradation control: Insights from the northwest arid regions
GenInfo: The paper only really modeled wind erosion and vegetation cover and didn't explicitly call these ecosystem functions or services

Title: Community size, activity and C:N stoichiometry of soil microorganisms following reforestation in a Karst region
GenInfo: Study in forested Karst region of China; select 5 sites on a chronosequence of forest recovery (0, 2, 4, 8, and 12 years); subsample and homogenize 10 soil cores per plot to assess soil physio-chemical properties and soil microbe metabolic and chemical properties in relation to temporal length of forest recovery

Title: Constructing more informative plant-pollinator networks: visitation and pollen deposition networks in a heathland plant community
GenInfo: Used pollinator visitation data and pollen deposition to create visitation networks (model)

Title: Coral identity underpins architectural complexity on Caribbean reefs
GenInfo: Coral reef

Title: Decline in medicinal and forage species with warming is mediated by plant traits on the Tibetan Plateau
GenInfo: Warming and grazing experiments - effect on medicinal and palatable plants

Title: Defining functional groups using dietary data: Quantitative comparison suggests functional classification for seed-dispersing waterfowl
GenInfo: Observed seagrass acreage coverage, used it to estimate N and C storage

Title: Detecting pest control services across spatial and temporal scales
GenInfo: the study was conducted on 24 organic broccoli farms in Santa Cruz, Monterey, and San Benito Counties during the summer grow- ing seasons of 2006–2008

Title: Determinants of establishment survival for residential trees in Sacramento County, CA
GenInfo: Monitored trees post-planting for data on species, survivorship, and structure; also pulled ownership and socioeconomic data (covariates) from Multiple Listing Services and US Census and

Title: Early eclosion of overwintering cotton bollworm moths from warming temperatures accentuates yield loss in wheat
GenInfo: time series analysis

Title: Ecological interactions shape the distribution of a cultural ecosystem service: Argali sheep (Ovis ammon) in the Gobi-Steppe of Mongolia
GenInfo: Distribution of a sheep species (which is cultural services as tourist attraction).

Title: Ecosystem change assessment in the Three-river Headwater Region, China: Patterns, causes, and implications
GenInfo: The three-rivers headwater region (TRHR) is a nature reserve located in the hinterland of the Qinghai–Tibet Plateau, an impor- tant source of fresh water resources in China and Asia

Title: Effects of coastal development on nearshore estuarine nekton communities
GenInfo: They sampled at two times per replicate, but these occurred within a 2 month period and were averaged (temporal dynamics not a focus)

Title: Effects of land-use change on wetland ecosystem services: A case study in the Donana marshes (SW Spain)
GenInfo: land cover changes over ~90 year period + social perceptions

Title: Effects of Morella faya tree invasion on aboveground carbon storage in Hawaii
GenInfo: Uses LiDAR data to model carbon sequestration in invaded areas. Carbon stored is allometrically determined.

Title: Emergy-based evaluation of pen-urban ecosystem services
GenInfo: a systems approach to evaluating 9 different ESs in Tawain's urbanizing ecosystems (forest, riparian wetlands, paddy rice fields, crop land, orchards, range farm, fallow, aquaculture, upstream and downstream). They used Emergy

Title: Enhancing Soil Organic Matter as a Route to the Ecological Intensification of European Arable Systems
GenInfo: used soil organic carbon as a proxy for SOM to see if increasing it led to just as much crop yield as when you add fertilizer. Also looked at pests

Title: Environmental Conservation and Social Benefits of Charcoal Production in Mozambique
GenInfo: participatory process informed Bayesian Belief Network

Title: Evaluating carbon storage, timber harvest, and habitat possibilities for a Western Cascades (USA) forest landscape
GenInfo: Used LandCarb model (Harmon 2012 [Harmon is one of the co-authors in current paper) to simulate forest vegetation and growth, timber harvest, and carbon dynamic and stores from different mgmt scenarios; use habitat capability index (HCI) models for each focal bird species (and use empirical from 2 published studies to parameterize HCI models); validate models with empirical (published) data

Title: Exploring the complex relations between water resources and social indicators: The Biobio Basin (Chile)
GenInfo: For the study, they used several dozen types of indicators, for which all data were pulled from the literature (no original data collection)

Title: Farm and landscape factors interact to affect the supply of pollination services
GenInfo: Abundance, diversity, and visitation to blueberry flowers to measure pollination services.

Title: Five Decades of Wetland Soil Development of a Constructed Tidal Salt Marsh, North Carolina, USA
GenInfo: comparison between constructed and natural marshes

Title: Flattening of Caribbean coral reefs: region-wide declines in architectural complexity
GenInfo: Kind of a meta-analysis, but does some modeling on top of that

Title: Floral abundance and richness drive beneficial arthropod conservation and biological control on golf courses
GenInfo: modified plots, made observations about them

Title: Forest Fire Severity Affects Host Plant Quality and Insect Herbivore Damage
GenInfo: Used natural variation in burned areas to test the effect of fire on plant quality and insect damage

Title: Functional diversity in cover crop polycultures increases multifunctionality of an agricultural system
GenInfo: mono- and poly-cultures of cover crops (1-8 species) used. 5 ecosystem services measured. Assessed richness, diversity, and traits with multifunctionality

Title: Global evidence of positive impacts of freshwater biodiversity on fishery yields
GenInfo: using FAO data combined with IUCN data to calculate species richness; 100 countries - inland freshwater fisheries

Title: Global evidence of positive impacts of freshwater biodiversity on fishery yields
GenInfo: Not sure if I should have checked the model box.

Title: Global patterns in lake ecosystem responses to warming based on the temperature dependence of metabolism
GenInfo: Global lakes dataset

Title: Green roof plant species diversity improves ecosystem multifunctionality
GenInfo: experimental manipulation of plants for green roofs, measured ecosystem service provision over 4 years

Title: Habitat assessment of a restored oyster reef in South Texas
GenInfo: created 1.5ha oyster reef complex and monitored oyster production

Title: Habitat conversion, extinction thresholds, and pollination services in agroecosystems
GenInfo: No location. Completely a simulation.

Title: Hydrological controls of fisheries production in a major Amazonian tributary
GenInfo: Dynamic factor analysis

Title: Identifying suitable multifunctional restoration areas for Forest Landscape Restoration in Central Chile
GenInfo: Use combo of published landcover maps to delineate binary forest, non-forest in study area; use different remote sensing datasets (30m res, and WorldClim) to extract predictor variables; used INVEST model to project 2 types of ES's (carbon seq, erosion potential) and 3-step combo of models to project habitat suitability. Lots of data processing in this paper (goal is to demo a new approach to ID forest areas for restoration and regeneration).  They do use land cover maps from three different time points, but to project likely forest recovery without intervention. Not assessing temporal trends as part of study questions.

Title: Impact of disturbance on above-ground water storage capacity of bryophytes in New Zealand indigenous tussock grassland ecosystems
GenInfo: *** THIS STUDY DID NOT TAKE PLACE IN AUSTRALIA. It was in New Zealand (Oceania)

Title: Impacts of grazing abandonment on ecosystem service provision: Coastal grassland as a model system
GenInfo: Test effects of three different grazing treatments on 12 biophysical variables as proxies for ES. Grazing treatments are full (pony, cow, and rabbit grazers present), rabbit-only, and abandoned (no grazers)

Title: Incorporating landscape heterogeneity into multi-objective spatial planning improves biodiversity conservation of semi-natural grasslands
Influence of Groundcover Vegetation, Soil Physicochemical Properties, and Irrigation Practices on Soil Fungi in Semi-arid Vineyards
GenInfo: Sampled from 5 vineyards in Southern Okanogan Valley in BC, Canada. Recorded veg composition in 25x50cm quadrats (16 per mgmt type at site, or used blocked design to get to 16 to get equal number replicates per treatment across sites) and took 3 soil samples per quadrat. Soil samples pooled and homogenized for soil chemical analysis, and 0.5g per homogenized sample subsampled for DNA extraction (for fungi of interest). Used PCR to quantify fungi (interested in 2 groups)

Title: Influence of soil and topography on aboveground biomass accumulation and carbon stocks of afforested pastures in South East Brazil
GenInfo: Use allometric relationships and biomass models from other studies to estimate aboveground and root biomass for trees; in field measures = tree DBH, site slope and altitude, recorded plant cover, and collected soil samples at three depths

Title: Invasive Species Impacts on Human Well-being Using the Life Satisfaction Index
GenInfo: modeled life satisfaction over time in counties affected by Emerald Ash Borer

Title: Landscape heterogeneity and farming practice alter the species composition and taxonomic breadth of pollinator communities
GenInfo: Uses pre-existing gradient of landscape heterogeneity and farms that are either conventional or have been organic for different amounts of time.

Title: Landscape structure influences bee community and coffee pollination at different spatial scales
GenInfo: Pollinator exclusion experiments were performed in all 15 of them, while we collected floral visitors on 10

Title: Large frugivorous birds facilitate functional connectivity of fragmented landscapes
GenInfo: Monitored flight pathways of frugivores to track seed dispersal across different habitat types using remote sensing data (for habitat types) and male bird daytime migrations using GPS (mist netted bird, banded with GPS units to record location every 15min), downloaded GPS data via VHF receivers. Study in South Africa. Tracked 30 birds (9 in breeding season, 21 in non-breeding season) for 543 days

Title: Machine learning for ecosystem services
GenInfo: machine learning methods with two case studies (Italy and South Africa)

Title: Mapping social-ecological vulnerability to inform local decision making
GenInfo: Used a previously published model from the lead author to model fishing effort and ecological exposure around Moorea, collected data on spatially explicit indicators in a 6-month window, and used census data for social component

Title: Mapping Soil Erosion Prevention Using an Ecosystem Service Modeling Framework for Integrated Land Management and Policy
GenInfo: modeled actual ES delivery vs. capacity for ES delivery and hosed that they do not match spatially or temporally. ES was soil erosion prevention and inputs to model were rainfall erosivity, soil erodibility, topography, soil cover

Title: Microhabitat heterogeneity promotes soil fertility and ground-dwelling arthropod diversity in Mediterranean wood-pastures
GenInfo: in agroforestry there are 5 microhabitat types (with low-intensity management). They looked at differences by microsite in soil chemical fertility (5 main measurements) and decomposition food webs (4 main groups of soil fauna). Goal was to inform management decisions to continue as is ... more heterogeneous mosaic is better

Title: Modeling and predicting the growth of the mussel, Mytilus edulis: implications for planning of aquaculture and eutrophication mitigation
GenInfo: Paper is primarily a modeling study. Used experimental data from mussel transplants (data belong to lead author, written up in different study) as mussel growth data for model.

Title: Modelling the potential impacts of urban ecosystem changes on carbon storage under different scenarios by linking the CLUE-S and the InVEST models
GenInfo: Mapping project for urban centers in China looking at loss of soil carbon due to urbanization under three different management scenarios

Title: Multifunctionality of floodplain landscapes: relating management options to ecosystem services
GenInfo: Surveyed experts and practitioners

Title: Optimizing intermediate ecosystem services in agriculture using rules based on landscape composition and configuration indices
GenInfo: Study does not take place in any location. Is a hypothetical/conceptual modeling example. Researchers based in Denmark.

Title: Organic farming promotes biotic resistance to foodborne human pathogens
GenInfo: Surveyed above and below ground beetle communities at 70 farm sites along US West Coast (WA, OR and CA), paired with complementary lab microcosm experiments to measure pig feces removal rates by beetles collected with organic farm sites vs. conventional farm sites. Can't find how many feces removal microcosm reps used. 4 reps per farm soil treatment (16 farms?) for soil community (bacterial diversity) microcosm experiment. Data collected over two years, but they do not model effect of time (it's more they needed that amount of time to sample all of their sites). Use a geospatial data layer to quantify land cover type (e.g. wetland, grassland, etc.) surrounding each farm.

Title: Partitioning spatial, environmental, and community drivers of ecosystem functioning
GenInfo: Sampled 36 stream sites across 3 regions in Sweden, no manipulations applied to streams, site selected based on location and quality (reference vs. more human influenced), selected for environmental gradients within each of 3 regions, but anthro activity within each region varied; use trait data from online databases or other published studies; used Moran's Eigenvector Maps (MEM) to model spatial structuring of collected EF data, and then applied variance partitioning to assess how much spatial location, environ variables, and spp community explains variability in data, both within and between 3 regions

Title: Pattern and scale in latitude-production relationships for freshwater fishes
GenInfo: mixed effects models using field data on 16 fish species

Title: Perennial, species-rich wildflower strips enhance pest control and crop yield
GenInfo: Field experiments were conducted between April and July 2014. Twenty winter wheat fields (hereafter focal fields) were selected in the central Swiss plateau (cantons Zurich and Aargau) within an area representative of the typical agricultural landscape of the Swiss lowlands, characterized by a small-scaled mosaic of arable crops, grasslands and forest fragments. Focal fields (average size: 1.31 ha  0.14 ha) were selected in pairs, with similar agricultural management based on farmer interviews and similar landscape composition.

Title: Potential tree and soil carbon storage in a major historical floodplain forest with disrupted ecological function
GenInfo: uses USDA Forest Inventory and United States General Land Office (GLO) surveys. We used the latest cycles from Arkansas during 2006–2010 (63% of trees), Mis- sissippi during 2009–2011 (20% of trees), and Missouri during 2004–2008 (8% of trees), as well as four other states

Title: Practical Challenges in Private Stewardship of Rangeland Ecosystems: Yellow Starthistle Control in Sierra Nevadan Foothills
GenInfo: Interviews of ranchers about their management and its effectiveness for control of an invasive starthistle

Title: Pronounced species turnover, but no functional equivalence in leaf consumption of invasive amphipods in the river Rhine
GenInfo: Note that there is some clearly experimental stuff, but some borders on observational (e.g., observed relationship between body mass and oxygen consumption is really just an observed biological correlation?)

Title: Reconciling community ecology and ecosystem services: Cultural services and benefits from birds in South African National Parks
GenInfo: I said 'no' to time, because although they mentioned that surveys were carried out over time to capture different birds in different seasons, I do not see this being incorporated into models

Title: Recovery Debts Can Be Revealed by Ecosystem Network-Based Approaches
GenInfo: Used abundance and biomass data on different reef and lagoon species before, during, and after a few disturbances to parameterize ecosystem network analysis models

Title: Recreational demand for clean water: evidence from geotagged photographs by visitors to lakes
GenInfo: Although they conducted no surveys/interviews, per se, methods were somewhat related as they extracted information from geo-tagged citizen photos onlineof lakes

Title: Regional-scale scenario modeling for coral reefs: a decision support tool to inform management of a complex system
GenInfo: CORSET model is described with an implementation in Meso-American marine waters with two scenarios

Title: Restoration of ecosystem carbon and nitrogen storage and microbial biomass after grazing exclusion in semi-arid grasslands of Inner Mongolia
GenInfo: In this study, the C and N storages in different parts of the plant– soil system, the concentrations of soil MBC and MBN, and the relationships between soil organic matter and microbial biomass were compared between three fenced sites and the paired adjacent grazed sites in the Hulunbuir grassland of Inner Mongolia. This study tested the hypothesis that grazing exclusion could enhance ecosystem C and N storage, soil microbial biomass, and that soil microbial biomass could be an indicator of the soil C and N dynamics induced by grazing exclusion. The specific objectives of this study were to (1) investigate the effects of grazing exclusion on the C and N storages in soil and ecosystem biomass, and soil MBC and MBN; (2) evaluate the potential relationships between soil organic matter and microbial biomass. These results suggest that grazing exclusion has the potential to sequester C and N in soils, but short- term (6 years) grazing exclusion might result in a higher C and N sequestration potential in the

Title: Restricting new forests to conservation lands severely constrains carbon and biodiversity gains in New Zealand
GenInfo: Takes place in New Zealand, which some people argue is not part of the Australian continent...

Title: Riparian buffer strips: Their role in the conservation of insect pollinators in intensive grassland systems
GenInfo: Observational because collected data at agricultural sites with pre-existing riparian management sites (no fence, fenced narrow strip, fenced wide strip)

Title: Riparian canopy expansion in an urban landscape: Multiple drivers of vegetation change along headwater streams near Sacramento, California
GenInfo: This study characterizes historical changes in riparian tree canopy over eight decades in relation to urbanization in a Central Valley wa- tershed, located in the metropolitan area of Sacramento, California. We used digital methods to analyze coarse- and fine-scale change in the extent of riparian tree canopy along the entire stream network, and investigated potential drivers of change by 1) quantifying changes in land cover across the watershed through the use of aerial photography, 2) characterizing historical and current stream flows from stream gage data and field observations, and 3) evaluating the contribution of exotic species to riparian tree stem density via field sampling throughout the stream network

Title: Seed arrival and persistence at the tidal mudflat: identifying key processes for pioneer seedling establishment in salt marshes
GenInfo: Tidal study at two different mudflats in the Netherlands. Set up parallel transects (3 total) at 5, 24, and 45m distance from marsh edge. Each transect had 5 0.5m^2 turf mat replicates used for assessing seed arrival and abundance (5 sediment samples collected per mat to study seedbank abundances). Additionally, 3 manipulated seed core blocks installed per transect to assess predation and persistence rates. Each block 3m apart and alternated real and fake seed. Seed cores contained 4 depth levels of seed (0, 5, 15, and 30mm depths), and each block contained 5 seed cores (arrayed in pentagonal/star shape). Installed/deployed experiment in Jan 2012 and took monthly measurements thereafter on everything through Aug 2012. Study does look at effect of month and interaction between time and distance.

Title: Seed-dispersal distributions by trumpeter hornbills in fragmented landscapes
GenInfo: they measured seed dispersal patterns for large frugivorous birds by GPS tracking male bird flight path coupled with gut transit times of several fruits the birds eat
MethodsNotes: GPS tracking hornbills and observing gut transit times for seeds in captive birds

Title: Simulation of ecosystem service responses to multiple disturbances from an earthquake and several typhoons
GenInfo: used InVEST to model changes to services

Title: Simulation of ecosystem service responses to multiple disturbances from an earthquake and several typhoons
GenInfo: Used InVEST. Unclear exactly what was simulated.

Title: Site-specific factors in the production of local urban ecosystem services: A case study of community-managed green space
GenInfo: amassed data from other sources

Title: Social-ecological outcomes in recreational fisheries: the interaction of lakeshore development and stocking
GenInfo: Adapted social-ecological model developed by two other published studies, and validated model output with empirical data on stocking and walleye fish counts from Wisconsin DNR

Title: Soils Determine Early Revegetation Establishment with and without Cover Crops in Northern Mixed Grass Prairie after Energy Development
GenInfo: Mix of experimental treatments (cover crops, seed mixes) and observed environmental variation (soil variables) to explain revegetatoin

Title: Spatial variability in ecosystem services: simple rules for predator-mediated pest suppression
GenInfo: This was totally simulation and didn't have an actual location for the model, i.e., it was generic so I chose global. Also note - it considered trends over 30 days in the model but didn't use multiple years of data in Q8

Title: Spatial variability in ecosystem services: simple rules for predator-mediated pest suppression
GenInfo: Strictly simulation study focused on terrestrial patchy landscapes for agricultural pests and predators of those pests.

Title: The relative importance of pollinator abundance and species richness for the temporal variance of pollination services
GenInfo: 16 blueberry fields over 3 years, 10 watermelon fields over 5 years. observed wild bee flower visits along 50m transect and measured pollen delivery per flower per visit for each species. looked at trends over time

Title: The Relevance of Conditional Dispersal for Bacterial Colony Growth and Biodegradation
GenInfo: This takes place entirely in the lab, not on any continent or ocean (the lab is in germany, so I chose europe)

Title: Towards systematic conservation planning adapted to the local flow of ecosystem services
GenInfo: ES provision and demand on local scale.

Title: Traditional ecological knowledge and medicinal plant diversity in Ecuadorian Amazon home gardens
GenInfo: Amazonian Ecuador; Among 138 garden owners interviewed in 11 communities, a broad knowledge of 104 pharmacological properties across 145 medicinal plant species is retained.

Title: Trait-based approaches for guiding the restoration of degraded agricultural landscapes in East Africa
GenInfo: five landscapes in 3 African countries studied for extent of soil erosion, vegetation cover and biomass, functional properties of the woody vegetation, and topsoil chemistry

Title: Transient Social-Ecological Stability: the Effects of Invasive Species and Ecosystem Restoration on Nutrient Management Compromise in Lake Erie
GenInfo: Modeling of scenarios of phosphorus management and influence on stability of the socio-ecological system.

Title: Tropical deforestation alters hummingbird movement patterns
GenInfo: GPS tracking of hummingbird movement as proxy for pollination disruption

Title: Uncovering the spatial dynamics of wild rice lakes, harvesters and management across Great Lakes landscapes for shared regional conservation
GenInfo: We report three primary analyses: (1) Regional characteristics: geospatial analysis of the relationships between wild rice lakes, management regimes and wild rice harvest across the study region; (2) Patterns of harvest: analysis of harvester use and spatial rela- tionships to wild rice lakes through case studies, landing site visits and in-depth interviews; (3) Decision making regarding the open- ing of harvest: visits with managers and committees.

Title: Urban biodiversity and social inequalities in built-up cities: New evidences, next questions. The example of Paris, France
GenInfo: Use published datasets: remote sensing, botanical inventories, census (counting as social survey)

Title: Using citizen scientists to measure an ecosystem service nationwide
GenInfo: To quantify the impact of different dung decompos- ers, we targeted 82 cattle farms across Finland (Fig. 1). This large-scale experiment was conducted in collabo- ration with citizen scientists from the 4H Federation of Finland, a youth organization with 79000 members distributed across the Finnish countryside.

Title: Wetlands in agricultural landscapes for nitrogen attenuation and biodiversity enhancement: Opportunities and limitations
GenInfo: t each location, we used a field design with measurements of denitrification and nitrous oxide emission rates at three or four plots along an elevation/wetness gradient perpendicular to the stream with 4 replications at each height. Sampling took place in summer in the period 2005–2007. Fluxes of N2O were measured between 9.00 and 16.00h using vented, closed flux chambers with an inner diameter of 15.2cm and a height of 24.2 cm.

Title: Wetlands in agricultural landscapes for nitrogen attenuation and biodiversity enhancement: Opportunities and limitations
GenInfo: Minimal data was collected, mostly a review. Not sure if it should count.

Title: When things don't add up: quantifying impacts of multiple stressors from individual metabolism to ecosystem processing
GenInfo: It doesn't establish where the study takes place but authors are from NA and Europe

Title: When things don't add up: quantifying impacts of multiple stressors from individual metabolism to ecosystem processing
GenInfo: Strictly simulations with hypothetical stressors (drivers) driving change at different levels in a population, all the way up to the service of leaf litter decomposition.

Title: Woody shrubs increase soil microbial functions and multifunctionality in a tropical semi-arid grazing ecosystem
GenInfo: They almost considered space for time in the sense that they used tree rings to estimate the age of shrubs (the length of time of a biotic driver)... however age was not incorporated into any models.
